intro: Scleria trialata var. rosea, commonly known as the pink marsh grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, commonly referred to as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in dense clusters. Its leaves are linear and often have a bluish-gray hue, contributing to its ornamental appeal. This variety is often cultivated in wetland gardens due to its ability to thrive in moist soil conditions.
